body:
`clang` is picky about unused `-L` flags in compiler wrappers which may confuse configure systems of some packages, see this workaround PR for petsc https://github.com/LLNL/spack/pull/589 . 
In case of `clang` compiler, by default add `-Qunused-arguments` to wrappers of both `cc` and `cxx` to suppress those warnings.
title: add extra flags to cc/cxx wrappers to suppress clang: warning: argument unused during compilation: '-L...'
